Article Title: Former Netherlands midfielder Johan Neeskens dies aged 73
Article Text:
Johan Neeskens. (Pic Credit - X)

Former Netherlands midfielder Johan Neeskens , considered one of the best midfielders of his generation, has died at the age of 73, the Royal Dutch Football Association ( KNVB ) confirmed on Monday.Neeskens fell ill while working with the KNVB's World Coaches project, for which he was an ambassador, in Algeria. The cause of death has not yet been revealed."The world not only says goodbye to a gifted sportsman but above all, to a compassionate, driven and wonderful person," the KNVB said.Neeskens was part of the Dutch sides that lost the 1974 and 1978 World Cup finals and in 2004 was named one of the 125 Greatest Living Footballers by FIFA . He won 49 caps for his country.A former box-to-box midfielder who was renowned for his stamina, grit and skill, Neeskens spent the majority of his playing career at Ajax Amsterdam , where he won the European Cup three seasons in a row between 1971-73, and at Barcelona , at both clubs alongside compatriot Johan Cruyff.After retirement he was an assistant coach for the Dutch national team at the 1998 World Cup as they finished fourth, and later worked under Frank Rijkaard at Barcelona.He also had a spell as head coach at South African club Mamelodi Sundowns, which was his final role in professional football and ended in 2012.
Article Summary: Former Netherlands midfielder Johan Neeskens has died at the age of 73. He was part of the Dutch sides that lost the 1974 and 1978 World Cup finals. In 2004 he was named one of the 125 Greatest Living Footballers by FIFA. The cause of death has not yet been revealed.

Article Title: Need those derbies & fan following, says Bhaichung Bhutia
Article Text:
(PTI Photo)

KOLKATA: Beginning its journey with eight teams 11 summers ago, Indian Super League (ISL) has gradually expanded to 13 teams over these seasons.After being left out of the country's new top-tier ahead of the erstwhile premier division I-League, Kolkata giants Mohun Bagan and East Bengal were included into ISL at the start of the 2019-20 season. Then, honouring the AFC-AIFF envisaged future roadmap for Indian football, I-League champions Punjab FC were promoted to ISL last season.Keeping up with the promise, Kolkata giants Mohammedan Sporting Club - as the current I-League winners - were also added to the lot before the start of the ongoing 2024-25 season. However, despite being the country's highest level of competitive football, ISL is yet to achieve the desired level of fan following among the supporters of the participating clubs.However, Bhaichung Bhutia , the former India captain and one of the few legends to play the game in the country, believes that Mohammedan SC 's presence will add to the intensity of the Kolkata derbies , which in turn will make Indian football more exciting for the fans. The Sikkimese Sniper – as Bhutia was famously known in his playing days, also hopes that the huge fan-bases that come along with the teams like MSC will result in a wider popularity of ISL."It's great for teams with a huge fan base such as Mohammedan SC to come into the ISL. I have always advocated for Mohun Bagan, East Bengal, and Mohammedan SC for coming into the ISL, because these are the teams that have huge passionate fans across India. To make the ISL competitive and interesting, you need those derbies and passionate fans to be there," Bhutia said in an exclusive interview shared with TOI.With talismanic India skipper and striker Sunil Chhetri hanging up his boots four months ago, Bhutia had a straightforward message for the youngsters who are shouldering the responsibilities of the Indian team under the stewardship of new head coach Manolo Marquez."You need to be consistent with the national team. You need to start delivering, and it's teamwork. Obviously, you will have great coaches, but as a player there should be consistency in performances, and you need to keep working hard," Bhutia added.Asked to pick his favourite teams for the season, Bhutia said, "It's difficult to predict the favourites for the title. Mohun Bagan (Super Giant) have put in a lot of budget to make a great team. Mumbai City FC, who didn't have a great Durand Cup, are a team that will always have a good side. FC Goa have been consistent throughout the years. I think these are the few teams that are going to be favourites for this season."Over the years, ISL has moved on from its novelty factor as global stars - well past their prime - have stopped coming to India to join a developing league for a season or two. But Bhutia personally still loves to go down the lane when asked about his memorable moments from the league."My best memory of the ISL will always be the first year, with some of the greatest footballers around the world coming and playing for us. In the first season, you had players like (Alessandro) Del Piero, Nicolas Anelka, Robert Pires, and a lot of big stars playing with our own local players!" he said before signing off.
Article Summary: Bhaichung Bhutia believes Mohammedan SC will add to the intensity of the Kolkata derbies. The Sikkimese Sniper also hopes that the huge fan-bases that come along with the teams like MSC will result in a wider popularity of ISL. The former India captain also has a straightforward message for the youngsters.

Article Title: Mohun Bagan booted from AFC Champions League Two for refusing to travel to Iran
Article Text:
File photo of Mohun Bagan team. (X Photo)

Mohun Bagan Super Giants ( MBSG ) are "considered to be withdrawn" from the AFC Champions League Two after they refused to travel to Iran for their Group A fixture against Tractor FC on 2 October. Mohun Bagan were due to play their second fixture of 2024-25 AFC Champions League 2 in Iran . However, their players were unwilling to travel to Tabriz, citing "safety and security reasons" after the death of Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah during an Israeli air strike in Lebanon.There were reports of missiles flying over a stadium during an AFC Champions League clash between Sepahan and Istiklol Dushanbe on the day of the match."In accordance with Article 5.2 of the AFC Champions League Two 2024/25 Competition Regulations (the “Competition Regulations”), the Asian Football Confederation (the “AFC”) confirms that India’s Mohun Bagan Super Giant are considered to have withdrawn from the AFC Champions League Two competition after the club failed to report to Tabriz, Islamic Republic of Iran, for their AFC Champions League Two Group A fixture against Tractor FC on October 2, 2024," the AFC said in a statement on Monday (7 October).AFC went on to confirm, in accordance with the rules, that no goals or points by Mohun Bagan will be considered when looking at the final rankings."Consequently, all matches played by Mohun Bagan Super Giant are cancelled and considered null and void in accordance with Article 5.6 of the Competition Regulations. For the avoidance of doubt, no points and goals in the club’s matches shall be taken into consideration when determining the final rankings in Group A pursuant to Article 8.3 of the Competition Regulations," it added.Mohun Bagan had battled out a goalless draw against Tajikistani side Ravshan Kulob in their opening game at the Salt Lake Stadium on 18 September.
Article Summary: Mohun Bagan refuse to travel to Iran for their Group A fixture against Tractor FC on 2 October. Players cite "safety and security reasons" after death of Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah during an Israeli air strike in Lebanon. No points or goals will be considered when looking at the final rankings.

Article Title: Rajasthan women crash to 5-0 defeat
Article Text: JAIPUR: It was an embarrassing start for hosts Rajasthan as they were outplayed by Chhattisgarh 5-0 in a Group E match of the 29th Senior Women's National Football Championship for Rajmata Jijabai Trophy 2024-25 at the Vidhyadhar Nagar Stadium here on Sunday. Priyanka Futan was the star performer for the winners with three goals. Hina Nirmalkar scored the other two goals for the winners.Rajasthan kept Chhattisgarh on the same score till the end of the first half, but Chhattisgarh came back stronger to score four goals in the second half.Nirmalkar scored two goals in the 49th and 55th minutes to increase the lead to 3-0. Futan scored two more goals in the 70th and then in the 81st minute to help Chhattisgarh seal a comprehensive victory.In the first match of the day, Punjab defeated Uttarakhand 3-1 to secure three points. Courtesy Lalam Haokip, Punjab took the lead in the 14th minute itself. In the 53rd minute, Mitali Melwal opened the account for Uttarakhand and levelled the scoreline. Punjab was gifted a goal when Uttarakhand's Achala Puri scored an own goal in the 69th minute while Nisha struck in the 73rd minute.Earlier, deputy chief minister Diya Kumari , who was also the chief guest, inaugurated the newly-constructed astro turf football ground at Vidhyadhar Nagar Stadium. "The stadium will be developed into a world-class facility. It features a FIFA-approved football field," she said.Youth affairs and sports secretary and Rajasthan State Sports Council chairman Neeraj K Pawan, Rajasthan Football Association secretary Dilip Singh Shekhawat, Rajasthan United Football Club president KK Tank and the association's Women's Wing chairperson Roshni Tank were also present on this occasion.
Article Summary: Priyanka Futan was the star performer for the winners with three goals. Punjab defeated Uttarakhand 3-1 to secure three points. Deputy chief minister Diya Kumari inaugurated the newly-constructed astro turf football ground at Vidhyadhar Nagar Stadium.

Article Title: European football roundup: Lewandowski hat-trick powers Barcelona, Bayern held in high-scoring thriller
Article Text: Robert Lewandowski's quick hat-trick propels Barcelona to a 3-0 win over Alaves, widening their lead over Real Madrid in La Liga. Despite Atletico Madrid’s early goal, Real Sociedad secures a draw. Juventus concedes late, ending in a 1-1 draw against Cagliari.

Article Title: Manchester United stalemate keeps Erik ten Hag in danger, Spurs rocked by Brighton
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Erik ten Hag maintains he has the support of Manchester United 's management despite a 0-0 draw against Aston Villa on Sunday, adding to a difficult season start.The draw leaves United in 14th place in the Premier League with just two wins from seven games.Bruno Fernandes hit the bar with a second-half free kick, while Diogo Dalot's block prevented Villa's Jaden Philogene from scoring.Ten Hag's side has not won in five consecutive games across all competitions.United co-owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe, who attended the match, did not confirm Ten Hag's job security earlier. However, Ten Hag remains optimistic. He stated, "We always speak, we speak every week. We are all onboard together, on one page."In another match, Tottenham Hotspur squandered a 2-0 lead to lose 3-2 at Brighton. Goals from Brennan Johnson and James Maddison initially put Tottenham ahead, but Brighton responded with goals from Yankuba Minteh, Georginio Rutter, and Danny Welbeck. This result is Tottenham's third defeat in seven league games.Earlier, Chelsea drew 1-1 with 10-man Nottingham Forest. Chris Wood scored for Forest, while Noni Madueke equalized for Chelsea. Despite Forest's James Ward-Prowse receiving a red card, Chelsea could not secure a win.This result leaves Chelsea in fourth place in the league going into the international break.
Article Summary: Erik ten Hag maintains he has the support of Manchester United's management. Ten Hag's side has not won in five consecutive games across all competitions. Tottenham Hotspur squandered a 2-0 lead to lose 3-2 at Brighton. Chelsea drew 1-1 with 10-man Nottingham Forest.

Article Title: Super League Kerala: Calicut demolish Thiruvananthapuram
Article Text: THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: Calicut FC secured a resounding 4-1 victory against Thiruvananthapuram Kombans in the sixth round of the Super League Kerala football at Chandrasekharan Nair Stadium, Thiruvananthapuram, on Sunday. The visitors capitalised on the hosts' defensive frailties, with goals from Muhammed Riyas (12), skipper Abdul Hakku (20), Barfo Ernest (45+2), and Kervens Belfort (58).Davi Kuhn scored the lone goal for the hosts.From the start, Calicut displayed a strong attacking intent. Kervens Belfort had a good opportunity to score in the fourth minute when he received the ball inside the box, but his shot went over the crossbar. Calicut's efforts paid off in the 12th minute when Muhammed Riyas headed the ball into the net. Khangenbam Thoi Singh received the ball inside the box from a long pass and cut it back from the right edge to find an unmarked Riyas. The striker made no mistake, heading the ball precisely to give Calicut the lead.The hosts' lack of marking of Calicut players inside the box resulted in the visitors doubling their lead in the 20th minute through a set piece. After winning a corner kick, Calicut skipper Abdul Hakku ran unnoticed into the Kombans box. With the ball perfectly positioned for a header, Hakku was in the right place to head it past Thiruvananthapuram goalkeeper Pawan Kumar to double Calicut's lead. Gani Muhammed nearly scored Calicut's third goal in the 28th minute, but his direct free kick hit the crossbar.Thiruvananthapuram coach Sergio Alexandre switched the positions of wingers Ganesan and Muhammed Ashar, hoping Ashar's speed would pressure Hakku and create space for other forwards in the Calicut box. However, the plan failed as Calicut gained a 3-0 lead just before half-time. Thoi Singh made a quick run along the right flank and crossed the ball into the box. Muhammed Riyas, under pressure from a Kombans defender, headed the ball to Barfo Ernest, who was behind him. Ernest took the ball on a half-volley and slammed it past Pawan Kumar.Kombans pulled one back in the 46th minute through Brazilian No. 10 Davi Kuhn, making it 3-1. However, Belfort's goal in the 59th minute sealed the match in Calicut's favour.
Article Summary: Calicut FC secured a resounding 4-1 victory against Thiruvananthapuram Kombans in the sixth round of the Super League Kerala football at Chandrasekharan Nair Stadium. The visitors capitalised on the hosts' defensive frailties, with goals from Muhammed Riyas (12), skipper Abdul Hakku (20), Barfo Ernest (45+2), and Kervens Belfort (58)

Article Title: India drawn against Togo in Davis Cup World Group I Play-offs next year; AITA says it's home tie
Article Text:
(AP Photo)

LONDON: India will play against Togo in the Davis Cup World Group I Play-offs to be held between January 31 and February 2 next year, according to the draw conducted by the International Tennis Federation ( ITF ) on Monday.The draw, which includes both World Group I and II play-offs, will see 52 nations compete in 26 home-and-away ties around the globe from either January 31-February 1 or February 1-2.World Group I play-offs will feature 26 countries while another 26 will compete in World Group II play-offs.India will feature in the World Group I Play-offs with the dates to be determined by the host nation.An official of the All India Tennis Association ( AITA ) told PTI that its team will play at home."It will be a home tie for our team," the official said.India had beaten Pakistan 4-0 in the 2024 play-offs in February in Islamabad to qualify for the World Group I. However, the Indian team lost to Sweden in Stockholm in September to drop down to Group I play-offs again for the 2025 edition.According to the official Davis Cup website, the choice of ground for the tie between India and Togo will be decided by lot at a later stage.Under the competition format, if the nations competing against each other have never previously met, last time met before 1970, or if they last faced each other at a neutral venue, then the choice of ground is decided by lot.India is yet to win the Davis Cup, having finished runner-up three times -- 1966, 1974 and 1987.The revised Davis Cup structure for the 2025 season has required some nations to play at a higher level than would have been the case in the previous format.Two nations which lost World Group II ties in September -- and would have competed in the 2025 World Group II play-offs -- will compete in the World Group I play-offs, the ITF said.Four nations which did not win promotion from regional Group III events -- and would not have played again until the 2025 Group III events -- will now contest the World Group II pay-offs next year.Winning nations from the 2025 World Group I play-offs will compete in World Group I ties in September alongside the losing nations from the 2025 Qualifiers first round.Losing nations from the 2025 World Group I play-offs and winning nations from the World Group II play-offs will compete in World Group II ties in September, the ITF added.
Article Summary: India will play against Togo in the Davis Cup World Group I Play-offs next year. The draw was conducted by the International Tennis Federation ( ITF) on Monday. The choice of ground for the tie between India and Togo will be decided by lot at a later stage.

Article Title: AITA rot leaves Indian tennis on the brink in singles
Article Text: How did we get here?" Vijay Amritraj wasn't looking at a map or eying a landmark. The tennis legend was merely marking the steps to oblivion. Amritraj was trying to wrap his head around the fact that India only had one player in the top-250 of the ATP and WTA rankings - Sumit Nagal at No. 83. This has been the case for over 12 months for the men.The 70-year-old pressed, "How come this isn't spoken about enough?" India has 10 doubles p layers in the top-150 of the individual doubles ranking, despite shrinking draw sizes."No kid picks up a tennis racket to play doubles, you play for singles," Amritraj said.Amritraj, who was president of the ATP Player Council from 1989 through to 1992 and again in 1994, cautioned that this isn't singles versus doubles, a fight India can ill afford.Still, questions must be asked. Where are India's singles players? What are the programmes we have supporting them?The All India Tennis Association (AITA) claimed to have 'conducted' 829 tournaments in 2023 but the AITA had little to show by way of numbers, like players coming out of this ostensibly robust system.AITA's tournament calendar - across age-groups - is conducted by the 28 member state associations, some clubs and even by parents desperate for their children to get match practice. The tournament structure clearly doesn't come together as a platform to launch Indians on international Tours -juniors or pros. Just a bunch of well-meaning people trying to shore up the game. Rohan Bopanna 's 'Doubles Dream of India', a programme that supports doubles specialists, has kept Indian tennis on the world map. Hardly surprising, then, that India's non-playing Davis Cup captain Rohit Rajpal played an unranked doubles player in a live singles rubber in a World Group 1 tie in Stockholm last month. The visitors, without Nagal, who was injured, failed to win a set.Somdev Devvarman who topped at No. 62 in the rankings in 2011, and Purav Raja, a doubles specialist, weren't amused. The same could be said of a lot of players, but these two decided to take the bull by the horns, taking the AITA to court for violation of the Sports Code.The players, however, haven't always been united. Nobody knows this better than AITA, who have made good use of the situation in the past - Krishnans and Amritrajs; Paes and Bhupathi. Divide and rule. It will be interesting to see what the nomenclature would read like this time as another set of players have been in talks with AITA, educating themselves on opportunity in administration.
Article Summary: India only has one player in the top-250 of the ATP and WTA rankings. The All India Tennis Association (AITA) claimed to have 'conducted' 829 tournaments in 2023. Rohan Bopanna's 'Doubles Dream of India' has kept Indian tennis on the world map.

Article Title: Gutsy Vaidehi reclaims National tennis women’s crown
Article Text:
Gujarat's Vaidehi Chaudhari with the women's singles winner's trophy at the Fenesta Open National tennis championship in New Delhi on Saturday.

All the buzz through the week had been around her 15-year-old rival, Maaya Rajeshwaran Revathi , but it made little difference to Vaidehi Chaudhari .The 24-year-old from Gujarat, who hadn’t dropped a set the whole week, maintained the clean slate by taming Maaya 6-3, 6-3 to reclaim the women’s singles title at the Fenesta Open National tennis championship in New Delhi on Saturday.“It was a really good match. I was playing a young girl. I had pressure as I was the top seed here, and had won the title before also. She (Maaya) had nothing to lose,” said Vaidehi, referring to her success in the tournament in 2022.She had also been runner-up to Shrivalli Rashmikaa last year, making it “three finals in a row”.Tamil Nadu’s 17-year-old Rethin Pranav claimed the men’s singles title, overcoming Nitin Kumar Sinha of Railways 6-4, 2-6, 6-2 for his maiden championship.Maharashtra’s Prisha Shinde clinched the Under-18 girls’ trophy, fighting back from 2-5 in the second set to beat Tamil Nadu’s Diya Ramesh 1-6, 7-6 (4), 6-2 in a two-hour long final.Aradhya Kshitij of Karnataka lifted the boys’ title with a 5-7, 7-5, 6-4 win over Manipur’s second seed Shanker Heisnam.The women’s final lasted an hour and 35 minutes, but it could have been even shorter. Vaidehi was up 5-0 in the second set when Maaya fought back to make it 3-5 before the Indian Billie Jean King Cup player nipped the late challenge from her rival.“I started cramping at 5-0. I was sick, was having cold and fever the last three days,” revealed Vaidehi.The title caps a fine run in the past few months for Vaidehi, starting with the $25,000 title in Chinese Taipei in June and followed by a semifinal in Kazakhstan and another final and a semifinal in Thailand.Despite the progress on court, it has been a struggle for Vaidehi to improve her tennis finances.“I was travelling alone in Taipei, and it was really hot out there. I played really well, I beat two players ranked higher than me. I was down 0-6, 0-3 in the second round, but came back strongly. In the final, I was again first set down. It’s the biggest title of my career so far,” she said.“The challenge for me is, being a woman, I cannot travel alone to some places (tournament venues) because they are not safe. If I take sponsorship, then I can have someone to travel with me,” said Vaidehi, who has her own travelling expenses covered by the Gujarat State sports authority.Yet, now that her goal for the year of winning a $25K title is achieved, Vaidehi is looking ahead with positivity.“I have slowly taken one step at a time. Now I am just more confident,” said Vaidehi, who will be travelling to Australia after a 10-day break.“There are a series of five big tournaments. I am looking forward to playing my first $75K event.”
Article Summary: Gujarat's Vaidehi Chaudhari won the women's singles title at the Fenesta Open National tennis championship in New Delhi on Saturday. The 24-year-old from Gujarat hadn’t dropped a set the whole week and maintained the clean slate by taming Maaya Rajeshwaran Revathi.
